content:
cURT ANDERSON Associated PressApril  

ST PERIOD PETERSBURG Fla PERIOD AP  Florida is moving to permanently close the leaky Piney Point wastewater reservoir that poured millions of gallons of water into Tampa Bay while threatening to burst open and flood nearby homes and businesses Gov PERIOD Ron DeSantis said Tuesday PERIOD

The Republican governor said at a news conference at the site that the chronic challenges of containing polluted water at the longclosed phosphate plant must end PERIOD

We want this to be the last chapter of the Piney Point story DeSantis said PERIOD

The reservoir is located just south of Tampa in Manatee County near waterways that flow into Tampa Bay PERIOD

The governor said he has directed the Department of Environmental Protection to develop a closure plan and that . million in existing agency funds would be used to treat the wastewater to reduce the nutrients that can cause algae blooms and fish kills PERIOD

When a leak developed at the site this month in a reservoir that once held  million gallons . million liters expertsfearing a collapsetriggered the evacuation of more than  homes businesses and farms in the area PERIOD

The worst was avoided as engineers rushed in vacuum trucks and other equipment to furiously pump out wastewater relieving the pressure PERIOD Crews also installed a steel plate at the leak site to prevent additional flooding from a seam in the reservoirs plastic liner PERIOD

The reservoir contains what are called phosphogypsum stacks a leftover from the phosphate mined for fertilizer PERIOD Officials say the water contains nitrogen phosphorus ammonia and small amounts of radium and uranium but is not radioactive PERIOD

There are about two dozen other similar phosphate wastewater reservoirs in Florida according to the U.S PERIOD Environmental Protection Agency PERIOD They hold about  billion tons of phosphogypsum stacks similar to those at Piney Point PERIOD The EPA also says about  of the nations phosphate is mined in Florida North Carolina and Tennessee PERIOD

In Florida the other phosphogypsum stacks have  so far  not had the same massive leak problems as Piney Point and there are no plans to close them according to the state Department of Environmental Protection PERIOD

However a Mosaic phosphate plant leaked millions of gallons of wastewater into Floridas underground aquifer after a sinkhole opened up in  beneath a reservoir holding phosphogypsum stacks PERIOD Another Mosaic leak happened at a different plant in  but officials said it was largely contained PERIOD

Noah Valenstein the Florida DEP secretary said the state also plans to sue HRK Holdings which bought the Piney Point property in  and promised a cleanup PERIOD Instead the company filed for bankruptcy following a  spill of  million gallons PERIOD

Stay tuned for litigation Valenstein said PERIOD This is it PERIOD The site has to be closed. wilton Simpson the Republican president of the Florida Senate said lawmakers would work to fully fund the cleanup and closure of Piney Point PERIOD The Legislature is currently in session PERIOD

By the end of session well have a closure plan Simpson said PERIOD
